# Welcome!
The "Single-Cell RNA-Seq Analysis with R" course is designed to equip participants with the knowledge and skills required to analyze single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-Seq) data using the R programming language. Single-cell RNA-Seq has revolutionized our understanding of cellular heterogeneity and gene expression at the single-cell level. This course will guide participants through the intricacies of scRNA-Seq data analysis, covering preprocessing, clustering, differential expression, trajectory inference, and visualization techniques.

-   Course material can be found in the workshop [github repository](https://github.com/omicscenter/scRNASeqwithR).

## Why R?

-   R is a programming and statistical language.
-   R is used for data Analysis and Visualization.
-   R is simple and easy to learn, read and write.
-   R is an example of a FLOSS (Free Libre and Open Source Software) where one can freely distribute copies of this software, read its source code, modify it, etc.


## Learning Objectives

At the end of the tutorial, participants will be able to

-  Understand Single-Cell RNA-Seq Technology and Experimental Design
- Preprocess Single-Cell Data
- Cluster Single Cells
- Identify Differentially Expressed Genes
- Infer Cell Trajectories and Pseudotime
- Visualize Single-Cell Data 
- Integrate Multi-Modal and Multi-Sample Data
- Address Single-Cell Data Challenges
- Build Interactive Data Reports

## Pre-requisites

-   Basic familiarity with R
-   Basic knowledge of bioinformatics
